spirit:field.spirit:name: OENOFF
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: SPI output enable active as required 1: The core will not assert the SPI output enable. This allows multiple slaves to be connected to a single master sharing a single slave select and software protocol implemented that can enable the slaves transmit data when a certain broadcast address SPI command is received

spirit:field.spirit:name: FRAMEURUN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Underruns are generated whenever a read is attempted from an empty transmit FIFO 1: Under run condition will be ignored for the complete frame if the first data frame read resulted in a potential overflow, i.e. the slave was not ready to transmit any data. If the first data frame is read from the FIFO and transmitted then an under run will be generated if the FIFO becomes empty for any of the remaining packet frames i.e. while SSEL is active Master operation will never create a transmit FIFO under run condition

spirit:field.spirit:name: INTTXURUN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt on transmit under run 0: Interrupt disabled 1: Interrupt enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INTRXOVFLOW
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt on receive overflow 0: Interrupt disabled 1: Interrupt enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INTTXDATA
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt on transmit data. 0: Interrupt disabled 1: Interrupt enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INTRXDATA
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt on receive data 0: Interrupt disabled 1: Interrupt enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: MASTER
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Run CoreSPI in slave mode 1: Run CoreSPI in master mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Core will not respond to external signals until this bit enabled. SPISCLKO driven to zero and SPIOE, SPISS (slave select) driven inactive 1: Core is active

spirit:field.spirit:name: SSEND
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' clears the SSEND interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMDINT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' clears the CMDINT interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXUNDERRUN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' clears the TXUNDERRUN interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXOVERFLOW
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' clears the RXOVERFLOW interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXDONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' clears the RXDONE interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXDONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' clears the TXDONE interrupt.

spirit:register.spirit:name: RXDATA
spirit:register.spirit:description: Receive Data Register Reading from this register reads one frame from the RX FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: TXDATA
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit Data Register Writing to this register writes one frame to the TX FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: INTMASK
spirit:register.spirit:description: Masked Interrupt Status These bits indicate the masked interrupt status by ANDING the interrupt enables in the CONTROL registers with the raw interrupt register. When any of these bits are set the INTERRUPT output will be active. The bits are cleared by writing to the Interrupt clear register

spirit:field.spirit:name: SSEND
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that SSEL has gone inactive

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMDINT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that the the number of frames set by the CMDSIZE register have been received as a single packet of frames (SSEL held active)

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXUNDERRUN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates in slave mode that the data was not available when required in the transmit FIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXOVERFLOW
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that in master and slave mode the receive FIFO overflowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXDONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that all frames have been received, data ready to be read

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXDONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that all frames, including last frame (see Aliased TX Data Register), have been transmitted

spirit:field.spirit:name: INTEN_SSEND
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: No effect 1: Enables the interrupt as SSEL goes high. SPI master and slave modes

spirit:field.spirit:name: INTEN_CMD
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: No effect 1: Enables Interrupt after the number of frames set by CMDSIZE (above) have been received as a single packet of frames (SSEL held active)

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMDSIZE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of frames sent before interrupt is generated when INTEN_CMD is set (see above).

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXFIFORST
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' will reset the TX FIFO. This bit always reads as zero

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXFIFORST
spirit:field.spirit:description: Writing a '1' will reset the RX FIFO This bit always reads as zero

spirit:field.spirit:name: ACTIVE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Core is still transmitting data

spirit:field.spirit:name: SSEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current State of SSEL

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXUNDERRUN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit FIFO under flowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXOVFLOW
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive FIFO overflowed

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXFULL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit FIFO is full, i.e. no space for more data

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXEMPTY
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive FIFO is empty, i.e. no data available to read

spirit:field.spirit:name: DONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: No of requested frames have been transmitted and received.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FIRSTFRAME
spirit:field.spirit:description: Next frame in Receive FIFO was first received after SSEL went active (Command Frame)

spirit:register.spirit:name: SSEL
spirit:register.spirit:description: Slave Select Register Specifies the slaves selected Default 0 (nothing selected). Write 1 each bit to select one or more slaves. Slave select output pin is active low. In TI mode the slave select outputs are inverted to become active high

spirit:register.spirit:name: TXDATA_LAST
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit Data Register Writing to this register writes one frame to the TX FIFO Also indicates to CoreSPI that this is the last frame in this packet before SSEL is supposed to go inactive, effectively allowing for the specification of the number of transmitted frames

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:description: APB System Clock; Reference clock for all internal logic
APB active low asynchronous reset
APB address bus; address internal registers.
APB Slave Select; select signal for register for reads or writes
APB Strobe. This signal indicates the second cycle of an APB transfer.
APB Write/Read. If high, a write occurs when an APB transfer takes place. If low, a read takes place.
APB write data
APB read data
APB ready Used to insert wait states. Not used in CoreSPI but part of APB3 Interface. Tied high (always ready).
APB Error Not used in CoreSPI but part of APB3 Interface. Tied low.

Interrupt Pending This active high output signal is the interrupt output signal from CoreSPI. It can be programmed to become active on certain events, informing the CPU that such an event has occurred. The CPU can then take appropriate action.
Indicates receive data available to be read.
Indicates transmit done - ready for more data.
Slave select in: Used to address CoreSPI in slave mode.
Serial data in: Shift data input, master or slave mode.
Serial clock in: Shift clock input, for slave mode operation.
Slave select: Generated by SPI in master mode.
Serial clock out: Generated by SPI in master mode.
Data output enable: When de-asserted output pad for SPISDO tri-stated). This is active when the SPI is writing output data and deactivated when there is not data to write. This signal is active high.
Serial data out: Generated by SPI master.
CoreSPI mode indicator: When 1- master. When 0 - slave.

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:script: Enable('CFG_MOT_MODE', Eq('CFG_MODE', 'Motorola Mode'));\ Enable('CFG_MOT_SSEL', Eq('CFG_MODE', 'Motorola Mode'));\ Enable('CFG_TI_NSC_CUSTOM', Or(Eq('CFG_MODE', 'TI Mode'), Eq('CFG_MODE', 'NSC Mode')));\ Enable('CFG_TI_NSC_FRC', And(Or(Eq('CFG_MODE', 'TI Mode'), Eq('CFG_MODE', 'NSC Mode')), Eq('CFG_TI_NSC_CUSTOM', 'Custom')));\ Enable('CFG_TI_JMB_FRAMES', And(Eq('CFG_MODE', 'TI Mode'), Eq('CFG_TI_NSC_CUSTOM', 'Custom')));\ Enable('CFG_NSC_OPERATION', And(Eq('CFG_MODE', 'NSC Mode'), Eq('CFG_TI_NSC_CUSTOM', 'Custom')));\ Validate('APB Data Width must be greater than or equal to the Frame Size.', GtOrEq('APB_DWIDTH', 'CFG_FRAME_SIZE'));\ Validate('For NSC mode, the Frame size must be set to 9 + required data frame size. Minimum data frame size is 4 bits.', Or(Not(Eq('CFG_MODE', 'NSC Mode')), And(Eq('CFG_MODE', 'NSC Mode'), GtOrEq('CFG_FRAME_SIZE', '13'))));\

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:description: CoreSPI is a controller core designed for synchronous serial communication using the Motorola, TI, or NSC Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI). The core is parameterized to allow user specification of clock phase, clock polarity, slave select behavior, FIFO depth, frame width, and mode. Operation is fully synchronous and operates on the system clock as well as the external SPI clock for slave mode.
